docs.lead_paragraph: UnitedHealth hiked its 2015 forecast after soaring past Wall Street's first-quarter expectations with a performance fueled partially by growth outside health insurance.

headline.main: UnitedHealth Hikes Forecast, Shares Edge to New Heights
headline.print_headline: UnitedHealth Hikes Forecast, Shares Edge to New Heights

docs.snippet: UnitedHealth hiked its 2015 forecast after soaring past Wall Street's first-quarter expectations with a performance fueled partially by growth outside health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Refugees from Africa, the Middle East and South Asia who are being held on the Pacific atoll of Nauru after being rejected by Australia could soon be paid to resettle in impoverished Cambodia in an arrangement by the Australian government that has been condemned by human rights activists as inhumane and potentially dangerous.

headline.main: Australia Will Soon Pay Refugees to Resettle in Cambodia
headline.print_headline: Australia Will Soon Pay Refugees to Resettle in Cambodia

docs.lead_paragraph: During a quarter-century in power, President Omar al-Bashir has succeeded in keeping an iron grip on Sudan despite repeated disasters that would have toppled many leaders. This week's election seems certain to entrench his rule.

headline.main: In Sudan, Poverty, Heavy Security Grip Under Longtime Leader
headline.print_headline: In Sudan, Poverty, Heavy Security Grip Under Longtime Leader

docs.snippet: During a quarter-century in power, President Omar al-Bashir has succeeded in keeping an iron grip on Sudan despite repeated disasters that would have toppled many leaders. This week's election seems certain to entrench his rule.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many said the legislation was short on details about how quality of medical care will be measured, and others expressed apprehension about whether the system would be fair.

headline.main: Doctors See Benefits and Risks in Medicare Changes
headline.print_headline: Doctors See Benefits and Risks in Medicare Changes

docs.abstract: Many doctors say legislation passed to overhaul how Medicare pays physicians is short on details and are worried about whether system might lead to loss of their autonomy.
docs.snippet: Many said the legislation was short on details about how quality of medical care will be measured, and others expressed apprehension about whether the system would be fair.

byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and REED ABELSON

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Strauch, who wrote two books about the brain, worked for Newsday before The Times hired her in 1995. She became science editor in 2011.

headline.main: Barbara Strauch, 63, Science and Health Editor at The Times and Author, Dies
headline.print_headline: Barbara Strauch, 63, a Times Editor, Dies

docs.abstract: Barbara Strauch, a reporter and editor for Newsday who later directed health and science coverage for The New York Times for a decade, dies at age 63.
docs.snippet: Ms. Strauch, who wrote two books about the brain, worked for Newsday before The Times hired her in 1995. She became science editor in 2011.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thinning hair affects some 30 million women in the United States, but thanks to new procedures and medications, those numbers could drop.

headline.main: New Treatments for Thinning Hair for Women

docs.abstract: New hair loss treatments are being marketed to women, who lose hair in fewer numbers than men but who often suffer greater social stigma because of it.
docs.snippet: Thinning hair affects some 30 million women in the United States, but thanks to new procedures and medications, those numbers could drop.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The new Medicare bill will help us focus on the quality, not quantity, of care.

headline.main: Keep Patients Healthy, and Doctors Sane

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by anesthesiologist Carol W Cassella addresses influx of newly-insured patients who are getting medical care, sometimes with untreated, long-term conditions, due to Affordable Care Act; observes patients often require specialty care at Medicaid and Medicare reimbursement rates, putting significant strain on practices; praises new bill that will modify payments and reward doctors for delivering quality care.
docs.snippet: The new Medicare bill will help us focus on the quality, not quantity, of care.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Refugees rejected by Australia will soon fly from the Pacific atoll of Nauru to be resettled in Cambodia, the Australian government said Thursday.

headline.main: Australia Says Nauru Refugees Will Soon Be Sent to Cambodia
headline.print_headline: Australia Says Nauru Refugees Will Soon Be Sent to Cambodia

docs.snippet: Refugees rejected by Australia will soon fly from the Pacific atoll of Nauru to be resettled in Cambodia, the Australian government said Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic presidential contender Hillary Clinton promised on Wednesday to help small businesses, saying U.S. tax rules were skewed in favor of big corporations and made it time consuming and costly for small employers to navigate the tax code.

headline.main: Clinton Pledges Help for Small Businesses at Last Stop on Iowa Tour
headline.print_headline: Clinton Pledges Help for Small Businesses at Last Stop on Iowa Tour

docs.snippet: Democratic presidential contender Hillary Clinton promised on Wednesday to help small businesses, saying U.S. tax rules were skewed in favor of big corporations and made it time consuming and costly for small employers to navigate the tax code.

headline.main: Clinton’s Enthusiasm for Questions Depends on Who’s Asking

docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton loved the questions she got from small-business owners in Norwalk, Iowa, but she was less enthused with the questions asked by reporters.
docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton loved the questions she got from small-business owners in Norwalk, Iowa, but she was less enthused with the questions asked by reporters.
